bibl.title: Aegyptiaca Romana. Nilotic Scenes and the Roman Views of Egypt.
bibl.note: Diss. Leiden Univ., 2001. - I. Introduction. - II. Corpus Figurarum Niloticarum [see in part. pp. 197-200, Nos 099-101: Egypt]. - III. Nilotic scenes in the Roman world. Interpretation and contextualisation. - IV. Roman Aegyptiaca. - V. The Roman discourse on Egypt reconstructed. - Tables. Appendix. Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: VERSLUYS M.J., Aegyptiaca Romana. Nilotic Scenes and the Roman Views of Egypt. (Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 144.)
Leiden, E.J. Brill, 2002, 8°, xiv-509 pp., 7 tabl., 171 figg. ISBN 90-04-12440-3. €125.

Diss. Leiden Univ., 2001. - I. Introduction. - II. Corpus Figurarum Niloticarum [see in part. pp. 197-200, Nos 099-101: Egypt]. - III. Nilotic scenes in the Roman world. Interpretation and contextualisation. - IV. Roman Aegyptiaca. - V. The Roman discourse on Egypt reconstructed. - Tables. Appendix. Bibliography. Index.

C.R. par Prudence J. Jones, BMCRev < http://ccat.sas.upenn.edu/bmcr/2003/2003-07-18.html >. - Janine Balty, RA 2004, pp. 123-124. - Molly Swetnam-Burland, AJA 108 (2004) pp. 482-483. - Rolf Tybout, JRA 16 (2003) No. 2, pp. 505-515, 3 figg. - Helen Whitehouse, BibO 61 (2004) coll. 324-328. - Steven E. Hijmans, BABesch 81 (2006) pp. 239-240. - Henri Lavagne, AntCl 74 (2005) pp. 675-676. - J.R. Clarke, NECJ 31 (2004) No. 3, pp. 330-333. - Marguerite Rassart-Debergh, Latomus 68 (2009) pp. 1175-1176.
